lyric: Lord, what will become of me / Once I've lost my novelty?
And you call me up again just to break me like a promise, so casually cruel in the name of being honest.
We're happy, free, confused and lonely at the same time
Words, how little they mean when you're a little too late.
I bet you think about me when you say, 'Oh my god, she's insane, she wrote a song about me.'
song: I Bet You Think About Me (ft. Chris Stapleton) (Taylor's Version)

lyric: Time won't fly, it's like I'm paralyzed by it, I'd like to be my old self again, but I'm still trying to find it.
I rewind thе tape but all it does is pause on thе very moment all was lost.
We were like the mall before the internet/ It was the one place to be/ The mischief, the gift-wrapped suburban dreams
And damn, Dorothea/ They all wanna be ya/ But are you still the same soul/ I met under the bleachers?
I should've asked you questions/ I should've asked you how to be/ Asked you to write it down for me/ Should've kept every grocery store receipt/ 'Cause every scrap of you would be taken from me
Sorry, I can't see facts through all of my fury.
Good thing my daddy made me get a boating license when I was fifteen/ And I've cleaned enough houses to know how to cover up a scene
